heading: more bad news for mosthated
subheading: script kiddie mosthated can't make his arraignment on computer cracking charges, because he's in jail for stealing a car and burglarizing a house. by lynn burke.
author: wired staff
text: infamous houston script kiddie mosthated was supposed to make a trip to dallas wednesday and plead guilty to computer cracking and teleconference fraud in one of the government's most embarrassing and notorious cyber cracking cases ever. but the arraignment had to be postponed, because mosthated, aka patrick w. gregory, 19, was jailed for burglarizing a house and stealing a car.the harris county sheriff's department said thursday that gregory was still in custody, and was scheduled to appear in court later in the day.deputy ray coronado said the charges against gregory were felonies. "they're both pretty serious," he said.before his arrest wednesday, gregory was already looking at jail time of up to five years and restitution payment of up to $250 million for his role as the leader of computer-cracking ring, globalhell. the group is accused of defacing websites that include the white house and the u.s. army.now his sentence is likely to be made more severe, according to people familiar with the case.
